answers.answer: Hi,It will help us know what all tests have you undergone. Did you undergo an MRI of brain? These symptoms of leg pain, tingling numbness may be due to peripheral neuropathy which can occur due to diabetes, thyroid deficiency and B 12 deficiency. It is important to rule out these causes.Easy bruising can occur due to fall in platelets, coagulation disorders and certain poisonings. This requires further evaluation. I would suggest you to get it done at your earliest. In the meantime you can try B 12 supplements and see if they help.Keep us posted.

I had blood work done, and my thyroid and sugar are good.  I had an MRI done about 3 weeks ago at the ER and it was fine.  I only get the bruising on my right thigh, first it was on the right  side of it then it left then another came out on the left side of it.  I have an appointment this Wednesday with a neurologist, hopefull she can help.  I also forgot to mention I sometimes feel pain on the upper part of my arms, like between the shoulder and elbow, on both arms, they last for a few minutes.  Sometimes I feel a pressure on my lower part of the head and the neck and a weird sensation on my throat.  And at times I feel "off balance".  When I'm walking or standing for a while, I start to feel as if my legs are heavy and I'm ready to faint and my neck begins to pull downwards.  In any case, I will be going to the neurologist this week and will let you know the results, thanks for the post.

So I went to the neurologist today and she said everything looks ok but she did order some blood working for:  Pheumatoid Factor, Comprehensive Metabaloic, Antinuclear antibody, CBC, Hemaglobin A1C, C Reactive Protein, Lymes, Sedimetation Rate, Serum Immunitixation, Thyroid Stimulating Hormone, and Vitamin B-12.  I had an EMG done and the doctor performing that exam suggested having blood work for Mysathenia Gravis since my left ear lid is droopy, so that blood work was also ordered.  I'll get back with the results once they're in.

I went to another neurologist for a second opinion.  I had a EEG done last night.  On the 22nd of this month I will have an MRI of the brain and one of the Cervical Spine done.  I must say, I'm taking Vitamin B-12 and it's been helping.  The amount of pins and needles, nerve tics, tingling sensation and pain I feel now is much less then what I felt before.  I'll keep you updated.

The neurologist ran several exams, for the thyroid, metabolic diabetes, antibodies, vitamin deficiency, liver and kidney function, all the exams she ran came back normal.  Because I have a droopy eyelid, she's running another EMG exam, which is more specific, to rule out myastenia gravis, she says the symptoms I have are related to anxiety.  Also, in 2004 I had a brain MRI done at that center because I was suffering from migraines.  5 years later, today, this neurologist says " I don't think there is anything structural to be concerned about since the results from 2004 were normal".  Is this possible?
What's the diganosis now cuz I'm feeling the same way.....thanks - sherwin

question: Nerve tics, tingling, pins and needles, leg pain, bruises...?About a month ago I fainted for less then a minute at the train station, I went to a neurologist who sent me to a cardiologist, I was diagnosed with vasovagal syncope. Ever since, I drink lots of fluids and vitamin water. But now, I noticed I get visual disturbances from time to time. Not only that, I feel nerve tics and tingling Sensations throughout my body, like my legs, feet, arms, hands, face and lips. I get headaches about 3 times a week. At times my scalp hurts. I also realized that there are times in which I feel the tingling sensations on my face and neck even my throat when I get into bed. One of the most bothersome symptoms are the leg pains I have. First it was only my right thigh, then the whole leg, now it's both legs and even my heels. I noticed I have bruises on my thighs. At times, even my lower back and buttocks hurt. I wanted to blame stress and anxiety for all this but I know my body and all this is strange. Also, I get nauseous for no reason.  At first I thought it was muscle pain, but this has been this way for two weeks now and it's getting worse.  600 mg motrin has done nothing for me.  I had migranes before, about 4 years ago with similiar symptoms but I didn't have any leg pain at all.
title: Tingling sensations, leg pain, pins and needles
